DEAR DIARY:
Scene: The Mall at Short Hills.
A young woman tells her boyfriend, ''No, I don't like that tie.''
''Why?'' her boyfriend asks.
To which she replies, ''It doesn't match my dress.''
In a local university cafeteria, the menu said, ''Filet of Fish.''
I asked the person at the counter, ''What kind of fish?''
She responded, ''Filet of fish.''
With a touch of exasperation, I said, ''Yes, I know, but a filet of what?''
With even more exasperation -- and perhaps a roll of her eyes, she said, ''Fish.''
I got the chicken.
(Yes, but what kind of chicken?)
VICKI SCHWARTZ
CAMPAIGN PROMISES
They promise they'll restore the ozone layer,
Stop ocean dumping, filter acid rain,
And banish hydrocarbons from our air.
How come they can't conduct a clean campaign?
BOB McKENTY
How's this for a New Jersey proverb? Live each day as if it's your last because life is like the right lane on Interstate 287 -- you never know when it's going to end.
WILLIAM DeBUVITZ
It's fun reading to the 4-year-olds at the Morristown Township Library. I always remember their faces, but sometimes their names escape me.
Recently I met one of our 5-year-old postgraduates on South Street.
''Hi, Mrs. Meyer,'' she said.
''Hi, how are you,'' I answered.
Then she said, ''Do you remember me?''
When I hesitated, she shot back, ''Does the name Nancy mean anything to you?''
DORIS L. MEYER
It was 11:30 on a recent sunny Friday morning when I was home from work caring for a sick child.
The phone rings, after which a woman with a funereal voice says, ''Hello. Mrs. Gray, please.''
''Speaking,'' I said.
The funereal voice then proceeded: ''This is (unintelligible) Memorial Park in East Hanover. This number has been selected to receive free burial space from us.''

How did she know I'm staring down the barrel of a major birthday and feeling vulnerable? That my eldest will soon be married and I'm feeling bumped up a generation? That in the time it took to address the invitations, two guests died?
Telemarketers have tried to separate me from my money in many ways. But this is the first time the Grim Reaper called on a peaceful weekday morning. The next time, I hope she gets a busy signal.
(Wonder if she'll settle for call waiting?)
CAROL LIPPERT GRAY

Big mistake. I had my hair cut, washed and dried, then rushed to the Division of Motor Vehicles to get a photograph taken for my driver's license. In my haste, I failed to check my face or hair before the photograph was taken.
My funny-faced appearance on the license prompted me to say, ''That is scary.''
Without hesitation, the clerk behind the counter replied: ''That is the way it is supposed to look. It's Halloween.''
JEANNE TURNER
